## Figures

### Figures with basic markdown

![A caption (\#fig:bb1)](bluebird.jpeg){width=20%}

Figure \@ref(fig:bb1) is included using basic markdown.

### Figures with `knitr`

```{r bb2, out.width = "20%", fig.cap = "Another caption", fig.align='center', echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics("bluebird.jpeg") 
```

Figure \@ref(fig:bb2) is included using `knitr::include-graphics`. These figures are referenced by labels prefixed `fig:`, see for example Figure \@ref(fig:pressure-plt). 

```{r pressure-plt, fig.cap='A figure from the `pressure` data', out.width='50%', fig.asp=.75, fig.align='center'}
plot(pressure, type = 'b', pch = 19)
```

### Tables
Tables generated by `knitr::kable()` are referenced by labels prefixed `tab:`, see for example Table \@ref(tab:iris-data).

```{r iris-data, tidy=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
knitr::kable(
  head(iris, 10), caption = 'Ten rows from the `iris` data set',
  booktabs = TRUE
)
```
